did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Southwest Folklore Center Sound Disc Collection, 1945-1987

origination.label: Creator:
origination.persname: University of Arizona. Southwest Folklore Center.

did.abstract: Sound discs of Mexican American, Native American and square dance music, acquired by the Southwest Folklore Center after 1980. Recordings in this collection are in 33-1/3, 45 and 78 rpm formats.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: University of Arizona Libraries, Special Collections

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Restricted. Researchers must use cassette tape copies of all sound discs or tape reels when they are available. An item level listing of all sound discs in the collection is available at the end of this document. Tape reel duplicates of the sound discs are numbered to correspond to the call numbers of the sound discs themselves.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: Requests for permission to publish from the collection should be discussed with the coordinator of the Southwest Folklore Center or the University of Arizona Manuscripts Librarian. It is the researcher's responsibility to obtain necessary publication rights and copyright clearances for any planned production. Copying of published tapes or records is prohibited.

prefercite.head: Credit Line
prefercite.p: Southwest Folklore Center Sound Disc Collection (SWF008). Special Collections, University of Arizona Libraries.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Since its creation in 1979, the Southwest Folklore Center has served as an archive for folk material. Its activities include actively researching and collecting information about Arizona's folk communities, generating outreach programs, and coordinating folk activities throughout the state. The compact disks located in the Archives have been collected since the early 1990s, and are mostly commercial recordings of various musicians, poets, and musical groups from Mexico and the southwestern United States. Collection activity is ongoing.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged according to accession into the collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of sound discs acquired by the Center since 1980. The collection emphasizes Mexican American music, Native American music, and square dance music. Sound discs containing similar material but acquired before 1980 may be found in the Southwest Folklore Center Pre-1980 Sound Disc Collection, with call number SWF 007.
